oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Rehearsal - 1946-10-28 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of a rehearsal from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on October 28, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lem Hawkins; Homegrown Trio; Hiram Higsby; Ann Bond; Mary Lou; Dick Reinhart; Chuck Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins tell a joke / (2:20) Lem Hawkins performs "[Unidentified banjo tune]" / (3:45) Hiram Higsby introduces the Homegrown Trio / (4:00) The Homegrown Trio performs "No Letter Today" / (6:28) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (7:30) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins perform "Wreck Of The Old 97" / (9:16) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (10:08) Ann Bond performs a medley of hillbilly songs / (12:18) Mary Lou and Dick Reinhart perform "One Step More" / (14:48) Chuck Davis performs the closing theme / (16:05) Closing statements [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Bond, Ann; Reinhart, Dick; Davis, Chuck;
